snippet: Beneath a calm imposed by military force, siege and starvation, the stage appears set for an unstable period of prolonged conflict that could explode again in months or years.
abstract: Relative tranquility in Syrian capital of Damascus following government's military success may be deceptive, as stage appears set for an unstable period of prolonged conflict that could explode again in months or years; government has established control of country's center and has negotiated cease-fires, but has resolved none of the deep political grievances that continue to tear at the national fabric.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Syria, and Mohammad Ghannam from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: Beneath a calm imposed by military force, siege and starvation, the stage appears set for an unstable period of prolonged conflict that could explode again in months or years.

headline.main: Relative Calm in Parts of Syria Is Deceptive
headline.print_headline: Break in Syrian War Brings Brittle Calm

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
